DOC.brief_summary: The objective study determine effect dexmedetomidine infusion Apnea / Hypopnea Index ( AHI ) individual previously document obstructive sleep apnea . We hypothesize dexmedetomidine infusion may reduce AHI patient obstructive sleep apnea ( OSA ) .
DOC.criteria: All individual previously undergone diagnostic polysomnography Sleep Lab document significant OSA , undergone change likely alter severity condition since time diagnostic sleep study ( loss weight ; surgical therapy OSA ; removal tonsil ; discontinuation medication likely affect arousal respiratory function , etc . ) eligible participate . Subjects identify complete outpatient sleep study record previous sleep study perform Duke Sleep Laboratory . After obtain informed consent , subject screen history physical examination , 12lead electrocardiogram , comprehensive metabolic profile . Exclusion criterion include history illicit drug alcohol dependence , impaired hepatic ( aspartate aminotransferase alanine aminotransferase > 2x upper limit normal range ) renal function ( receive dialysis serum creatinine > 1.5 mg/dL ) , highgrade ( > 1st degree ) heart block , know allergy dexmedetomidine .
